Metadata.Title: Authentication Is Required for All Sensitive Pages
Metadata.DirectLink: Authentication Is Required for All Sensitive Pages

Content.Data:
==Applies To==
* Web Applications
==What to Check For==
Verify that authentication and authorization are required for all sensitive pages.
==Why==
All pages that have private information should require authentication and authorization to prevent unauthorized information disclosure. Use role-based authorization policies because they are relatively simple to manage correctly.
==How to Check==
To verify that authentication and authorization are required for all sensitive pages:
# **Identify all sensitive pages.** Make a list of all pages that handle sensitive or private information. # **Verify that all sensitive pages require authentication.** Visit each sensitive page with a web browser to make sure it requires authentication.
==How to Fix==
To require authentication for all private resources:
# **Identify all sensitive pages.** Make a list of all pages that handle sensitive or private information. # **Define roles.** Define access roles for your application. These roles should include administrative users and various types of users specific to your application. # **Implement authentication.** Implement and document authentication APIs to satisfy all application requirements. # **Require authentication for all sensitive pages.** Add code to all sensitive pages that checks if the user is authenticated and authorized to view them.
